oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Atlas of the city of Nashville 1908. [Plate 24B]
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1 map; 58 x 75 cm. A plat map of downtown Nashville, Tennessee and the surrounding area, originally published in 1908 by G. M. Hopkins Company, showing the various buildings, landscapes, acreage, and street routes for several blocks. Original building structures are depicted on the map, such as First Evangelical Reformed Church, Mt. Zion Baptist Church, Second Presbyterian Church, Third Baptist Church, Buena Vista School, Flower Mission, Weakly Memorial, United Brethren Church (labeled as Church on the map), and First German Evangelical Lutheran Church. This plat map is reproduced from the source: Atlas of the city of Nashville, Tennessee : from official records, private plans and actual surveys, G. M. Hopkins, [Philadelphia, Pa.] 1908. Scale 150 feet to an inch. The original dimensions of the map, in the atlas publication: 15 1/2 x 22 3/4 in. (i.e. 58 x 75 cm.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: First Evangelical Reformed Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Mt. Zion Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Second Presbyterian Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Third Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Buena Vista School (Nashville, Tenn.); Flower Mission (Nashville, Tenn.); Weakly Memorial, United Brethren Church (Nashville, Tenn.); First German Evangelical Lutheran Church (Nashville, Tenn.);
